newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Italian PM cool about new euro banknotes.
newsitem.headline: Italian PM cool about new euro banknotes.

text.p: Prime Minister Romano Prodi may be among the most passionate advocates of a single European currency, but he thinks a new purple euro banknote is a mess.
Seven brightly coloured euro banknotes were unveiled at a summit of European Union leaders on Friday, depicting architectural designs.

"I don't like the highest denomination note because it's a mess," Prodi told a news conference on Saturday, the summit's last day. The 500 euro note is purple and shows a suspension bridge on one side and a glass building on the other.
Sitting alongside Prodi, Italian Foreign Minister Lamberto Dini grimaced when asked what he thought of the euro notes.
Although the EU plans to introduce the euro in 1999, the notes will not make their way into people's pockets until 2002.
